result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Asher Jason Spitz

records.addlTxt: 3:03 PM Defendant Asher Jason Spitz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for Asher Jason Spitz.  Attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $500,000 with conditions of No contact directly or indirectly with victims CB and MB, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Follow all medication recommendations through the chapter 51 order. Preliminary hearing requested in person. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 1:45.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim C.B or M.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Follow all medication recommendations through Chapter 51 order.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
